title: Analyzing survey data (collected with Kobo)
text: package includes real survey data, coming humanitarian Multi-Sector Needs Assessment) run Haiti INGO IMPACT Initiatives 2022. Now, let‚Äôs imagine want analyze variable h_2_type_latrine, single-choice categorical variable type latrines used household. analysis run kobo_select_one() function returns data frame labels row per category variable, along weighted proportion, confidence intervals, unweighted counts, number missing values, etc.. preview output: can easily visualize results ggplot2:  want get labels directly kobo, can use: x = var_value_label instead x = var_value. Now, let‚Äôs disaggregate results urban/rural setting, using group argument:
code: library(SurveyLiteR)  # Load the example data data("design") # Survey design with weights, strata, clusters data("main") # Survey data (household-level data) data("survey") # KoboToolbox survey sheet data("choices") # KoboToolbox choices sheet data("analysis_dap") # Data Analysis Plan (31 indicators) # This is a generic survey analysis function so <- svy_proportion(design, "h_2_type_latrine") # This is a specific KoboToolbox analysis function so <- kobo_select_one(design, "h_2_type_latrine", survey, choices) so[, .(var_value, stat, stat_low, stat_upp, n_unw)] |> head(5) #>                   var_value        stat     stat_low    stat_upp n_unw #>                      <char>       <num>        <num>       <num> <int> #> 1:                    aucun 0.054484395 0.0458488645 0.064636228   221 #> 2:     defecation_air_libre 0.143896781 0.1284883750 0.160812018   636 #> 3: latrine_fosse_avec_dalle 0.165391479 0.1473257185 0.185191407   566 #> 4: latrine_fosse_sans_dalle 0.103669595 0.0871157213 0.122945421   410 #> 5:                      nsp 0.001886509 0.0006492863 0.005468372     5 library(ggplot2) library(scales) library(forcats) library(data.table)  # reorder and factor by highest value last (for ggplot2 horizontal bar chart) so[, var_value := forcats::fct_reorder(var_value, stat, .desc = FALSE)]  # plot ggplot(so, aes(x = var_value, y = stat)) +   geom_col() +   scale_y_continuous(labels = label_percent()) +   geom_errorbar(     aes(ymin = stat_low, ymax = stat_upp),     width = 0.2,     linewidth = 0.5   ) +   labs(     title = "Proportion of households by type of latrines used",     x = "",     y = "",     caption = "Source: MSNA Haiti 2022 (IMPACT Initiatives)"   ) +   coord_flip() +   theme_minimal() +   theme(     plot.title.position = "plot"   ) # Disaggregation by urban/rural setting so2 <- kobo_select_one(   design,   "h_2_type_latrine",   survey,   choices,   group = "milieu" )  # reorder and factor by highest value last (for ggplot2 horizontal bar chart) so2[, var_value := forcats::fct_reorder(var_value, stat, .desc = FALSE)] # recode group values so2[,   group_key_value := forcats::fct_recode(     group_key_value,     "Urban" = "urbain",     "Rural" = "rural"   ) ] # plot (using ggplot4.0.0+ palette.fill.discrete) ggplot(so2, aes(x = var_value, y = stat, fill = group_key_value)) +   geom_col(width = 0.8, position = position_dodge(width = 0.8)) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = label_percent()) +   geom_errorbar(     aes(ymin = stat_low, ymax = stat_upp),     width = 0.2,     linewidth = 0.5,     position = position_dodge(width = 0.8)   ) +   labs(     title = "Proportion of households by type of latrines used, by setting",     x = "",     y = "",     fill = "",     caption = "Source: MSNA Haiti 2022 (IMPACT Initiatives)"   ) +   coord_flip() +   theme_minimal() +   theme(     plot.title.position = "plot",     legend.position = "top",     palette.fill.discrete = c("#40afefff", "#f99d56ff")   )

title: Analyzing survey data (collected with Kobo)
text: Create DAP based included example: Supported analysis types: "mean" - numeric variables (e.g., c_total_age_3a_17a) "median" - skewed numeric variables (e.g., f_5_depenses_ba) "select_one" - single-choice categorical (e.g., h_2_type_latrine) "select_multiple" - multiple-choice questions (e.g., h_1_acces_eau) "ratio" - rates (format: ‚Äúnumerator,denominator‚Äù) "interact" - cross-tabulations (format: ‚Äúvar1,var2‚Äù)
code: # View the example DAP structure head(analysis_dap)  # Your DAP should have at least the 'analysis', 'var', and 'na_rm' columns: my_dap <- data.frame(   analysis = c("mean", "select_one", "select_multiple", "ratio"),   var = c(     "c_total_age_3a_17a", # mean: number of children aged 3-17     "h_2_type_latrine", # select_one: type of latrines     "h_1_acces_eau", # select_multiple: water access issues     "e_freq_regt,c_total_age_3a_17a" # ratio: school attendance rate   ),   na_rm = c("yes", "no", "yes", "no"),   sector = c("Demographics", "WASH", "WASH", "Education"),   indicator = c(     "Mean number of children aged 3-17 in household",     "% of households by type of latrine",     "% of households by water access issues",     "School attendance rate among children aged 3-17"   ) )

title: Analyzing survey data (collected with Kobo)
text: svy_*() functions return standardized data frames : group_key: Grouping variable () group_key_value: Specific group level (grouped) var: Variable name var_value: Category/level (categorical variables) stat: Main statistic (mean, proportion, etc.) stat_low, stat_upp: Confidence interval bounds stat_unw: Unweighted statistic n_unw: Unweighted sample size stat_type: Type analysis performed n_tot_unw: Total sample size group (, else overall) n_tot: Total weighted sample na_count_tot: Total missing values variable analysis_key: Unique identifier analysis interactions, additional columns like interact_key interact_key_value included. analysis_key built follows: \<stat_type\> @/@ \<var\> %/% \<var_value\> @/@ \<group\> %/% \<group_value\>. instance, key proportion Household Hunger Scale (HHS) categories setting : proportion @/@ hhs_cat %/% Little @/@ setting %/% rural. using kobo_*() functions, additional metadata columns survey choices sheets included, labels variables choices type question.

title: Kobo survey analysis from a data analysis plan ‚Äî kobo_analysis_from_dap
text: well formatted data analysis plan data frame least three columns: analysis, vars, na_rm, , analysis one following types: "mean", "median", "select_multiple", "select_one", "ratio", "interact". vars variables analyze. "mean", "median", "select_multiple", "select_one", single variable. "ratio", two variables separated comma, first one numerator second one denominator. "interact", two variables separated commas, interacted. na_rm either "yes" "", indicating whether NAs removed analysis. takes default variables, e.g. tries label, calculates confidence intervals, separators default. Choices NULL. separator choices can changed depending dataset's variable names formatted. Level can changed.

Can NULL skip survey validation. choices (data.frame | NULL) choices sheet Kobo. Can NULL. group (character[1+] | NULL) Variables group . Default NULL group. group_key_sep (character[1] | NULL) string separate grouping variables. Can NULL skip check. na_rm (logical[1] | NULL) NAs removed? Can NULL skip check. vartype (character[1] | NULL) Type variance estimation. Can NULL skip check. level (numeric[1] | NULL) Confidence level 0 1. Can NULL skip check. check_vars_not_in_group (logical[1]) Whether check vars group (default: TRUE). check_equal_length (logical[1]) Whether check nums denoms equal length (default: TRUE). warn_low_ci (logical[1]) Whether warn CI level 90% (default: TRUE). separators (character[1+] | NULL) Additional separator parameters validate. Can NULL. survey_required_cols (character[1+]) Required columns survey sheet (default: c("type", "name")). choices_required_cols (character[1+]) Required columns choices sheet (default: c("label", "name")).

text: design (srvyr::design) srvyr::design object. vars (character[1+] | NULL) Variables analyze. Can NULL functions use vars. nums (character[1+] | NULL) Numerator variables (ratio functions). Default NULL group. group_key_sep (character[1] | NULL) string separate grouping variables. Can NULL skip check. na_rm (logical[1] | NULL) NAs removed? Can NULL skip check. vartype (character[1] | NULL) Type variance estimation. Can NULL skip check. level (numeric[1] | NULL) Confidence level 0 1. Can NULL skip check. check_vars_not_in_group (logical[1]) Whether check vars group (default: TRUE). check_equal_length (logical[1]) Whether check nums denoms equal length (default: TRUE). warn_low_ci (logical[1]) Whether warn CI level 90% (default: TRUE). separators (character[1+] | NULL) Additional separator parameters validate. Can NULL.
